job.title: Computer Science / Computer Engineer Co-op (Automotive Wheel Balancing)
job.description: Hunter Engineering Company is a global leader in the development and manufacturing of computer based automotive service equipment. Hunter’s award-winning research and development team of engineers is responsible for hundreds of patented and exclusive features on our equipment.<br><br>We are in search of enthusiastic and self-motivated sophomores, juniors, or seniors with a major or minor in a field of study cohesive with Computer Science and/or Computer Engineering. Our goal is to provide an experience that will teach by example how to progress from academics-based software projects to real world successful product(s).<br><br><strong><u>Job Summary<br><br></u></strong>This position is primarily responsible for the writing of new test software to automate data gathering and work with the QA Department and Project Engineers to maintain existing software.<br><br><strong> CS/CE C++ Co-Ops gain experience in: <br><br></strong>Software Quality Assurance<br><ul><li> Exposure to Software Version Control and the debugging environment through Visual Studio </li><li> Work with Hunter’s QA Department and Project Engineers to maintain existing software. </li><li> Learn concepts of multiple models (varying feature sets) support and backwards compatibility. </li><li> Write new test software to automate data gathering <br></li></ul>New Feature Development / Testing<br><ul><li> Learn how mechanical aspects influence software during the design process, working directly with Mechanical Engineers and ME Co-Ops. </li><li> Execute test plans under the direction of a project engineer, format the results in a useable and effective manner, and analyze the results against stated objectives </li><li> Minor analysis and engineering calculations <br></li></ul>Equipment Evaluation<br><ul><li> Gain experience assisting with competitive analysis and equipment operation. <br></li></ul>Capstone Presentation / Exposure to Upper Leadership<br><ul><li> Near the end of the job, our C++/balancer Co-Op students are well equipped to prepare a compelling Capstone PowerPoint presentation </li><li> Co-Ops can present their presentations live to all the other Co-Ops and upper management/leadership. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>The individual will be involved in a variety of projects which may include:<br><ul><li> Prototype construction and evaluation </li><li> Test program development and administration </li><li> Shop experience, hands-on work experience </li><li> Minor analysis and engineering calculations </li><li> Analyzing data and using Microsoft Word and Excel to prepare reports </li><li> Design and Fabricate Test Fixtures <br></li></ul><strong><u>What To Expect<br><br></u></strong><strong> Qualifications <br><br></strong>It will be our intent and purpose to provide the individual with real world experience, which includes assisting in the progression of a product from concept stage to production. The work done by co-ops in this position is applied to actual Hunter products. The work is normally very individualized even if you are working in a larger group. We host many co-ops annually. Our goal is to provide an experience that will be an important, effective first step in the career of a future engineer.<br><br>Also visit our website for testimonials from previous co-ops<br><br>https://www.hunter.com/about-us/careers/co-op/<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Minimum 3.0 GPA (must be on resume) </li><li> Majo/Minor studies in Computer Scienceand/ or Computer Engineering </li><li> Experience with C++, Linux and/or Microsoft VS a plus </li><li> Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint </li><li> Excellent communication skills.</li></ul>
